results.title: The Job for you
results.creator_credit: Alan Anderson, Malcolm Otton and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: The Commonwealth Employment Service established shortly after World War II, aims at finding a job suitable for the person and a person suitable for the job. Each district office has an up to date list of vacancies in its own and in other areas. Finding specialists for professional employment, placing handicapped people in work and arranging employment for migrants are important aspects of the work, and play their part in building Australia’s future.

results.title: The Japanese garden
results.creator_credit: dentsu and Japan. National Tourist Organisation
results.brief_description: Atmospheric shots of misty valleys begin this stylised look at the natural beauties of the Japanese countryside and traditional gardens. Shows use of water and stone ornaments in formal gardens. Oriental music provides a complimentary background. No commentary.

results.title: The Jamestown story
results.creator_credit: Karl Schiffman, Douglas Leiterman, Philip S. Hobel and Document Associates
results.brief_description: Focuses on Jamestown, a community with a history of strikes and labor troubles. Discusses an innovative program of labor management and co-operation that brought Jamestown back from the edge of economic disaster. Includes interviews with workers on the shop floor as well as managers.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Karl Schiffman, Douglas Leiterman, Philip S. Hobel and Document Associates

results.title: The Jackson years: the new Americans
results.creator_credit: Dennis Azzarella and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description: Looks at Andrew Jackson’s life prior to his election to the US presidency in 1828. Uses Alexis de Tocqueville’s book, ‘Democracy in America’ and a stage play to highlight aspects of Jackson’s life, such as his duel with Dickenson; his days in the militia; and his eventual election as president.

results.title: The Jackeroo
results.creator_credit: Richard Mason, Maslyn Williams and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Life as a jackeroo on Thylungra Station, a one million acre property in south-western Queensland. The jackeroo tells of the satisfaction of life in the outback. We tour the station and see pelts collected from a trapper, windmills and fences checked, sheep mustered, drafted and sheared, and meet boundary riders. Gives a sense of a hot, dusty and expansive country.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Richard Mason, Maslyn Williams and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: The Ivory Coast experiment
results.brief_description: A film report showing how television is being used in new ways to teach primary school children and their teachers, even in remote villages of the Ivory Coast in Africa.

results.title: The Israelis
results.brief_description: Examines the current state of the culture and people of the country of Israel. Explores the relationship of Jews and Arabs in the aftermath of recent hostilities, and shows how Israelis relate to their own Jewish heritage.

results.title: The Isle of Rhum
results.creator_credit: Christopher Mylne and Films of Scotland
results.brief_description: A film about the Hebridean Island off the coast of Scotland. Here wild natural beauty contrasts with the Edwardian elegance of Kinlock Castle, the Nature Conservancy’s most ambitious experiment.
